availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington P. Ray (Caldwell co., ky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Margarett H. Ray. Married to Mildred Teresa McGough Ray. Father of William B. Ray, Thomas Ray, Sarah E. Ray, and W. J. Ray. Laborer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Farmersville in 1860. Employed Frank Felker as a farm laborer in Farmersville in 1860. Employed M. Felker as a carpenter in Farmersville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 296B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, p. 131.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Farmersville, 160, p. 486C.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #55-6512.
"Washington P. Ray (1828-1902)," Find A Grave, Memorial #46266871, accessed May 24, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46266871.
